content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: Tuition at certain state schools is gratis to military veterans.
Volunteers donate their time without expecting to be remunerated.
The community will be the beneficiary of the money for the botanical gardens.
The community center solicited canned goods for the food bank.
Since none of them won the competition, the class commiserated together.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: The choral group garnered several rave reviews at the state competition.
The paper recycling campaign had been Mr. Horowitz’s pet project since its inception.
The surgeon had to amputate Mel’s fingertip to save his hand.
Howie felt magnanimous as long as there was money in his pocket.
The bureau blocked a practicable exit.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: Friends told her “all things happen for a reason” so often during her ordeal that the sentiment became trite. What best describes the sentiment?
There are myriads of fish in the sea. Which of the following best describes the fish?
Which of the following is most likely to be amputated?
Which does not describe an aptitude?
Which of the following is true of a boon? It is

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: The United States government does not financially support its Olympic athletes. In many other countries around the world, athletes with enormous aptitude are identified at an early age. They then receive financial backing from the government to ensure they are trained to realize their greatest potential.

Unfortunately, for many U.S. athletes, the most difficult obstacle in the path to victory at the Olympics isn’t skill, effort, or talent—it’s their incapacity to raise the funds needed to continue full-time training. Athletes who are able to successfully solicit funding for their athletic careers from magnanimous donors have their basic costs covered, but these athletes are rarely wealthy. After all, Olympians aren’t remunerated for the hours they spend training. Only the most famous U.S. Olympic athletes are sponsored by companies and therefore paid the way we might expect, given their talent and status.

content.question: The meaning of aptitude (line 3) is
In line 9, incapacity means
The word solicit (line 11) most nearly means
In line 12, magnanimous means
In line 14, the phrase “remunerated for” means
